title: Valentine one-page prompt with evasive No and Yes meme reveal

requirements.summary: Create a single Valentine prompt screen with the question and exactly two options: Yes and No.
acceptanceCriteria: On initial load, the page shows the question text "Will you be my Valentine?" and two clearly visible buttons labeled "Yes" and "No".
There are no additional flows, menus, or unrelated content on the initial screen.

file_operations.description: Implement the single-page Valentine prompt UI that renders the question text and exactly two buttons ("Yes" and "No") as the only interactive options on initial load.

requirements.summary: Make the No option evade interaction for both pointer (mouse/trackpad) and iPad touch so it cannot be activated.
acceptanceCriteria: When the pointer hovers over (or approaches) the "No" button, the button repositions to a different spot on the screen.
On touch devices (e.g., iPad), attempting to tap the "No" button causes it to move before the tap can activate a click action.
The "No" button cannot be successfully clicked/activated through normal interaction.

file_operations.description: Add evasive positioning logic for the "No" button (e.g., randomized reposition within a bounded container) and handle both pointer and touch interactions (including onPointerEnter/onPointerMove and onPointerDown/onTouchStart equivalents) to move it before activation and prevent successful clicks.

requirements.summary: On Yes click, replace the prompt with a meme image result view and remove the Yes/No UI.
acceptanceCriteria: Clicking "Yes" shows a meme image and no longer shows the two-option prompt.
The displayed meme image includes the text "Good Choice Doctor Zara Ji".
The "No" evasive behavior is no longer relevant/visible after "Yes" is clicked.

file_operations.description: Add state-driven UI switching so clicking "Yes" replaces the prompt with a result view that renders the static meme image and hides/disables the Yes/No buttons (and therefore the "No" evasive behavior).

requirements.summary: Apply a cohesive pink-and-white romantic theme with responsive, centered layout and touch-friendly controls for iPad Chrome.
acceptanceCriteria: Primary UI uses pink and white as dominant colors (background, accents, buttons).
Buttons are large enough for touch (no tiny tap targets) and layout adapts to tablet viewport sizes without overflow or clipped content.
Overall styling remains simple and romantic (consistent fonts, spacing, and visual hierarchy).

file_operations.description: Create global styles (including Tailwind base directives if used by the project) to establish a pink-and-white romantic theme (background, typography defaults) and ensure the app has a consistent visual baseline.

Apply responsive layout styling (centered container, comfortable spacing) and touch-friendly button sizing/contrast optimized for iPad Chrome while keeping the UI limited to the prompt and result view.

requirements.summary: Include the generated meme image as a static frontend asset and load it directly from the frontend after Yes is clicked.
acceptanceCriteria: A generated image file exists at frontend/public/assets/generated and is referenced by the UI after clicking "Yes".
The app does not require backend endpoints to display the meme image.

file_operations.description: Add the provided generated meme image asset at frontend/public/assets/generated/meme-good-choice.dim_800x800.png for direct static serving by the frontend.
Reference and render the static asset frontend/public/assets/generated/meme-good-choice.dim_800x800.png in the post-Yes result view (no backend fetching).
